poem:
"Postcards from the heart of a Princess"

The lady's portrait frozen in time,
In her "revenge" dress or posing alone, sublime.
A majestic silhouette bathed in the Taj's gleam,
Gifted to the lens by the Princess of dreams.
In an Angolan minefield, with dignity she trods,
Or reaching out, to hold the forgotten ones' hands.
Unspoken stories in negatives; Diana's noble trance,
A dance of compassion, her silent stance.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Now some of these images, including ones of her walking through an Angolan minefield and shaking hands with an Aids patient,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
